column5: We certainly know how screwed up the weather has been but this is crazy.  A buddy sent me this pic this morning of these 2 frogs on Scugog.  The pic was taken January first, not the best quality but you get the idea.
Frogs? or Brown Trout? hehehe  Tony
LOL!!!  Good one Tony.  It's too bad that he couldn't get a closer shot but they are frogs.

Joonmoon & I went to Guelph lake on New Years day, and caught a frog while searching for lures in the stump fields. He wouldn't pose for a pic though. Water was high for January, about six feet higher than in the past. Most of the best snagging stumps were still under water so we didn't find any lures this year. Only the back bays protected from wind had ice, and it was only an inch thick.
Know that's funny. Never seen that before.
I don't know about the legality of it up there in Canada, but that's some good eatin' hoppin' around up there on the ice!
As a Montreal Canadiens fan, I did not know what to expect when I opened this thread!  Glad to see the little hoppers!   Don
They think it's spring.  Up here the spring peepers call on the ice.  Maybe I should check outside tonight.    Pam
I was gonna say Me and Roy were'nt there
The title sounds like a new Disney ad.FROGS ON ICE.
Last time I saw frogs on ice was in the mid 70s, but that was a sudden early freeze at the start of the coldest winter I remember.  Poor frogs were caught by surprise in early October.
If I was there, I would have said, You're crazy frogs. CraaaaaazzzzzzzzyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyYYYYYYYY!!
